subject: Self Care
title: The History of Burnout
description: A 60-second lesson on The History of Burnout.

hook.text: In 1974, psychologist Herbert Freudenberger noticed clinic volunteers becoming emotionally dead. He named it burnout.

buildup.text: Freudenberger saw passionate people lose their drive, compassion, and health â€” all from giving too much too long.

discovery.text: He noticed the most dedicated workers burned out first. Passion without boundaries becomes the fuel for its own fire.

twist.text: For decades, burnout was dismissed as weakness. Only in 2019 did the WHO officially recognize it as a syndrome.

climax.text: Burnout is not laziness. It's the cost of caring too much without the systems to sustain that care safely.

punchline.text: Burnout strikes the passionate hardest. That's the irony.

quiz.question: Who first coined the term 'burnout' in psychology?
